lecture1.title: The Basics WebSys F21, 2021-09-03
lecture1.description: Learn the basics of Web Systems Development at RPI.

lecture2.title: Apache WebSys F21, 2021-09-10
lecture2.description: Learn how to install XAMPP and use the program.

lecture3.title: git learn lecture
lecture3.description: Learn how to use Git and its most prominent features.

lecture4.title: HTML5 addendum aka it's not 2017 anymore
lecture4.description: Learn about the HTML5 format and the improvements it features.

lecture5.title: Cascading Style Sheets (CSS)
lecture5.description: Learn about CSS syntax, formating, and its properties.

lecture6.title: Make your own CSS grid, 2021-09-21
lecture6.description: Experiment with using CSS to create a grid to organize information.

lecture7.title: Advanced CSS workshop, 2021-09-24
lecture7.description: Experiment with using more advanced CSS to manipulate objects on a webpage.

lecture8.title: JavaScript: It's a thing, 2021-09-28
lecture8.description: Learn about the JavaScript programming language.

lecture9.title: AJAX & JSON
lecture9.description: Learn about AJAX and JSON how they can be used together.

lecture10.title: jQuery, 2021-10-05
lecture10.description: Learn about jQuery and see how it streamlines using JavaScript.

lecture11.title: Front End Optimization
lecture11.description: Learn about the different front end optimizations used in the industry and how to implement them.

lecture12.title: Quiz 1 Review, 2021-10-12
lecture12.description: Review on the topics and structure of Quiz 1.

lecture13.title: PHP
lecture13.description: Learn about PHP and how to program with it.

lecture14.title: More PHP: Interfaces, Abstract classes, and Polymorphism
lecture14.description: Learn about interfaces, abstract class, and polymorphism within PHP.

lecture15.title: MySQL WebSys 1
lecture15.description: Learn the basics of MySQL databases and how they're commonly used.

lecture16.title: PHP and MySQL Sessions & Persistence
lecture16.description: Learn how PHP and MySQL can interact with eachtoerh and about PHP sessions and persistence.

lecture17.title: Authentication & Authorization WebSys 1
lecture17.description: Learn about the differences of authentication and authorization.

lecture18.title: Quiz 2 Review
lecture18.description: Review on the topics and structure of Quiz 2.

lecture19.title: Looking ahead to Web Science and short wrap-up
lecture19.description: Learn about what Web Science is about for next semester and what we've accomplished this semester.

lab1.title: Lab 1
lab1.description: This lab will have you create a portfolio website for your group, which will include a portfolio site/page for each individual member of the group within.

lab2.title: Lab 2
lab2.description: There’s a law that says all schools with Federal funding need to have some sort of programming about the Constitution on 9/17. Each group will make their own interactive Constitution web app/site.

lab3.title: Lab 3
lab3.description: Have you seen the ITWS web page? It’s not very good… https://science.rpi.edu/itws/. Your job this week (as individuals, this is not a group lab) is to make us a new site.

lab4.title: Lab 4
lab4.description: You have gotten your very first commission to create a website for a real client! The client is Gamma Nu Eta, the ITWS Honors Society. They have an immediate need for a new website, and they’ve agreed to let you make it!

lab5.title: Lab 5
lab5.description: We are going to optimize a game I made called Free Bee game as found at https://freebee.fun/play/. It is a clone of the New York Times game Spelling Bee. You can find the source code for the game here: https://github.com/freebee-game/web-client.

lab6.title: Lab 6
lab6.description: This is a calculator I used to own when I was in junior high school: https://www.cbpbook.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/casio-scientific-calculator-fx-100ms-original.jpg. Your (individual) lab is to recreate this calculator. You already have the basics (hopefully!) and you don’t have to recreate all the buttons from the calculator image.

lab7.title: Lab 7
lab7.description: Create an interactive web page (using HTML/CSS/JS/PHP) that allows the user to do all the steps in part 2 through a web interface. Basically, make me a grade book for class :)

lab8.title: Lab 8
lab8.description: Create a JSON document containing information about the lectures and labs you've encountered in the Web Sys course this semester. Then design a front end to browse the contents of the JSON file. Finally, develop a back end to the site with PHP.
